26/**
27 * DOC: Panel Self Refresh (PSR/SRD)
28 *
29 * Since Haswell Display controller supports Panel Self-Refresh on display
30 * panels witch have a remote frame buffer (RFB) implemented according to PSR
31 * spec in eDP1.3. PSR feature allows the display to go to lower standby states
32 * when system is idle but display is on as it eliminates display refresh
33 * request to DDR memory completely as long as the frame buffer for that
34 * display is unchanged.
35 *
36 * Panel Self Refresh must be supported by both Hardware (source) and
37 * Panel (sink).
38 *
39 * PSR saves power by caching the framebuffer in the panel RFB, which allows us
40 * to power down the link and memory controller. For DSI panels the same idea
41 * is called "manual mode".
42 *
43 * The implementation uses the hardware-based PSR support which automatically
44 * enters/exits self-refresh mode. The hardware takes care of sending the
45 * required DP aux message and could even retrain the link (that part isn't
46 * enabled yet though). The hardware also keeps track of any frontbuffer
47 * changes to know when to exit self-refresh mode again. Unfortunately that
48 * part doesn't work too well, hence why the i915 PSR support uses the
49 * software frontbuffer tracking to make sure it doesn't miss a screen
50 * update. For this integration intel_psr_invalidate() and intel_psr_flush()
51 * get called by the frontbuffer tracking code. Note that because of locking
52 * issues the self-refresh re-enable code is done from a work queue, which
53 * must be correctly synchronized/cancelled when shutting down the pipe."
54 */
55
56#include <sys/cdefs.h>
57__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: intel_psr.c,v 1.5 2018/08/27 07:28:57 riastradh Exp $");
58
59#include <drm/drmP.h>
60
61#include "intel_drv.h"
62#include "i915_drv.h"
63
64static bool is_edp_psr(struct intel_dp *intel_dp)
65{
66 return intel_dp->psr_dpcd[0] & DP_PSR_IS_SUPPORTED;
67}
68
69static bool vlv_is_psr_active_on_pipe(struct drm_device *dev, int pipe)
70{
71 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
72 uint32_t val;
73
74 val = I915_READ(VLV_PSRSTAT(pipe)) &
75 VLV_EDP_PSR_CURR_STATE_MASK;
76 return (val == VLV_EDP_PSR_ACTIVE_NORFB_UP) ||
77 (val == VLV_EDP_PSR_ACTIVE_SF_UPDATE);
78}
79
80static void intel_psr_write_vsc(struct intel_dp *intel_dp,
81 const struct edp_vsc_psr *vsc_psr)
82{
83 struct intel_digital_port *dig_port = dp_to_dig_port(intel_dp);
84 struct drm_device *dev = dig_port->base.base.dev;
85 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
86 struct intel_crtc *crtc = to_intel_crtc(dig_port->base.base.crtc);
87 enum transcoder cpu_transcoder = crtc->config->cpu_transcoder;
88 u32 ctl_reg = HSW_TVIDEO_DIP_CTL(cpu_transcoder);
89 uint32_t data;
90 const char *ptr = (const char *)vsc_psr;
91 unsigned int i;
92
93 /* As per BSPec (Pipe Video Data Island Packet), we need to disable
94 the video DIP being updated before program video DIP data buffer
95 registers for DIP being updated. */
96 I915_WRITE(ctl_reg, 0);
97 POSTING_READ(ctl_reg);
98
99 for (i = 0; i < sizeof(*vsc_psr); i += 4) {
100 memcpy(&data, &ptr[i], 4);
101 I915_WRITE(HSW_TVIDEO_DIP_VSC_DATA(cpu_transcoder, i >> 2),
102 data);
103 }
104 for (; i < VIDEO_DIP_VSC_DATA_SIZE; i += 4)
105 I915_WRITE(HSW_TVIDEO_DIP_VSC_DATA(cpu_transcoder,
106 i >> 2), 0);
107
108 I915_WRITE(ctl_reg, VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VSC_HSW);
109 POSTING_READ(ctl_reg);
110}
111
112static void vlv_psr_setup_vsc(struct intel_dp *intel_dp)
113{
114 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port = dp_to_dig_port(intel_dp);
115 struct drm_device *dev = intel_dig_port->base.base.dev;
116 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
117 struct drm_crtc *crtc = intel_dig_port->base.base.crtc;
118 enum i915_pipe pipe = to_intel_crtc(crtc)->pipe;
119 uint32_t val;
120
121 /* VLV auto-generate VSC package as per EDP 1.3 spec, Table 3.10 */
122 val = I915_READ(VLV_VSCSDP(pipe));
123 val &= ~VLV_EDP_PSR_SDP_FREQ_MASK;
124 val |= VLV_EDP_PSR_SDP_FREQ_EVFRAME;
125 I915_WRITE(VLV_VSCSDP(pipe), val);
126}
127
128static void skl_psr_setup_su_vsc(struct intel_dp *intel_dp)
129{
130 struct edp_vsc_psr psr_vsc;
131
132 /* Prepare VSC Header for SU as per EDP 1.4 spec, Table 6.11 */
133 memset(&psr_vsc, 0, sizeof(psr_vsc));
134 psr_vsc.sdp_header.HB0 = 0;
135 psr_vsc.sdp_header.HB1 = 0x7;
136 psr_vsc.sdp_header.HB2 = 0x3;
137 psr_vsc.sdp_header.HB3 = 0xb;
138 intel_psr_write_vsc(intel_dp, &psr_vsc);
139}
140
141static void hsw_psr_setup_vsc(struct intel_dp *intel_dp)
142{
143 struct edp_vsc_psr psr_vsc;
144
145 /* Prepare VSC packet as per EDP 1.3 spec, Table 3.10 */
146 memset(&psr_vsc, 0, sizeof(psr_vsc));
147 psr_vsc.sdp_header.HB0 = 0;
148 psr_vsc.sdp_header.HB1 = 0x7;
149 psr_vsc.sdp_header.HB2 = 0x2;
150 psr_vsc.sdp_header.HB3 = 0x8;
151 intel_psr_write_vsc(intel_dp, &psr_vsc);
152}
153
154static void vlv_psr_enable_sink(struct intel_dp *intel_dp)
155{
156 drm_dp_dpcd_writeb(&intel_dp->aux, DP_PSR_EN_CFG,
157 DP_PSR_ENABLE | DP_PSR_MAIN_LINK_ACTIVE);
158}
159
160static void hsw_psr_enable_sink(struct intel_dp *intel_dp)
161{
162 struct intel_digital_port *dig_port = dp_to_dig_port(intel_dp);
163 struct drm_device *dev = dig_port->base.base.dev;
164 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
165 uint32_t aux_clock_divider;
166 uint32_t aux_data_reg, aux_ctl_reg;
167 int precharge = 0x3;
168 static const uint8_t aux_msg[] = {
169 [0] = DP_AUX_NATIVE_WRITE << 4,
170 [1] = DP_SET_POWER >> 8,
171 [2] = DP_SET_POWER & 0xff,
172 [3] = 1 - 1,
173 [4] = DP_SET_POWER_D0,
174 };
175 int i;
176
177 BUILD_BUG_ON(sizeof(aux_msg) > 20);
178
179 aux_clock_divider = intel_dp->get_aux_clock_divider(intel_dp, 0);
180
181 drm_dp_dpcd_writeb(&intel_dp->aux, DP_PSR_EN_CFG,
182 DP_PSR_ENABLE & ~DP_PSR_MAIN_LINK_ACTIVE);
183
184 /* Enable AUX frame sync at sink */
185 if (dev_priv->psr.aux_frame_sync)
186 drm_dp_dpcd_writeb(&intel_dp->aux,
187 DP_SINK_DEVICE_AUX_FRAME_SYNC_CONF,
188 DP_AUX_FRAME_SYNC_ENABLE);
189
190 aux_data_reg = (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 9) ?
191 DPA_AUX_CH_DATA1 : EDP_PSR_AUX_DATA1(dev);
192 aux_ctl_reg = (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 9) ?
193 DPA_AUX_CH_CTL : EDP_PSR_AUX_CTL(dev);
194
195 /* Setup AUX registers */
196 for (i = 0; i < sizeof(aux_msg); i += 4)
197 I915_WRITE(aux_data_reg + i,
198 intel_dp_pack_aux(&aux_msg[i], sizeof(aux_msg) - i));
199
200 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 9) {
201 uint32_t val;
202
203 val = I915_READ(aux_ctl_reg);
204 val &= ~DP_AUX_CH_CTL_TIME_OUT_MASK;
205 val |= DP_AUX_CH_CTL_TIME_OUT_1600us;
206 val &= ~DP_AUX_CH_CTL_MESSAGE_SIZE_MASK;
207 val |= (sizeof(aux_msg) << DP_AUX_CH_CTL_MESSAGE_SIZE_SHIFT);
208 /* Use hardcoded data values for PSR, frame sync and GTC */
209 val &= ~DP_AUX_CH_CTL_PSR_DATA_AUX_REG_SKL;
210 val &= ~DP_AUX_CH_CTL_FS_DATA_AUX_REG_SKL;
211 val &= ~DP_AUX_CH_CTL_GTC_DATA_AUX_REG_SKL;
212 I915_WRITE(aux_ctl_reg, val);
213 } else {
214 I915_WRITE(aux_ctl_reg,
215 DP_AUX_CH_CTL_TIME_OUT_400us |
216 (sizeof(aux_msg) << DP_AUX_CH_CTL_MESSAGE_SIZE_SHIFT) |
217 (precharge << DP_AUX_CH_CTL_PRECHARGE_2US_SHIFT) |
218 (aux_clock_divider << DP_AUX_CH_CTL_BIT_CLOCK_2X_SHIFT));
219 }
220
221 drm_dp_dpcd_writeb(&intel_dp->aux, DP_PSR_EN_CFG, DP_PSR_ENABLE);
222}
223
224static void vlv_psr_enable_source(struct intel_dp *intel_dp)
225{
226 struct intel_digital_port *dig_port = dp_to_dig_port(intel_dp);
227 struct drm_device *dev = dig_port->base.base.dev;
228 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
229 struct drm_crtc *crtc = dig_port->base.base.crtc;
230 enum i915_pipe pipe = to_intel_crtc(crtc)->pipe;
231
232 /* Transition from PSR_state 0 to PSR_state 1, i.e. PSR Inactive */
233 I915_WRITE(VLV_PSRCTL(pipe),
234 VLV_EDP_PSR_MODE_SW_TIMER |
235 VLV_EDP_PSR_SRC_TRANSMITTER_STATE |
236 VLV_EDP_PSR_ENABLE);
237}
238
239static void vlv_psr_activate(struct intel_dp *intel_dp)
240{
241 struct intel_digital_port *dig_port = dp_to_dig_port(intel_dp);
242 struct drm_device *dev = dig_port->base.base.dev;
243 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
244 struct drm_crtc *crtc = dig_port->base.base.crtc;
245 enum i915_pipe pipe = to_intel_crtc(crtc)->pipe;
246
247 /* Let's do the transition from PSR_state 1 to PSR_state 2
248 * that is PSR transition to active - static frame transmission.
249 * Then Hardware is responsible for the transition to PSR_state 3
250 * that is PSR active - no Remote Frame Buffer (RFB) update.
251 */
252 I915_WRITE(VLV_PSRCTL(pipe), I915_READ(VLV_PSRCTL(pipe)) |
253 VLV_EDP_PSR_ACTIVE_ENTRY);
254}
255
256static void hsw_psr_enable_source(struct intel_dp *intel_dp)
257{
258 struct intel_digital_port *dig_port = dp_to_dig_port(intel_dp);
259 struct drm_device *dev = dig_port->base.base.dev;
260 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
261
262 uint32_t max_sleep_time = 0x1f;
263 /* Lately it was identified that depending on panel idle frame count
264 * calculated at HW can be off by 1. So let's use what came
265 * from VBT + 1.
266 * There are also other cases where panel demands at least 4
267 * but VBT is not being set. To cover these 2 cases lets use
268 * at least 5 when VBT isn't set to be on the safest side.
269 */
270 uint32_t idle_frames = dev_priv->vbt.psr.idle_frames ?
271 dev_priv->vbt.psr.idle_frames + 1 : 5;
272 uint32_t val = 0x0;
273 const uint32_t link_entry_time = EDP_PSR_MIN_LINK_ENTRY_TIME_8_LINES;
274
275 if (intel_dp->psr_dpcd[1] & DP_PSR_NO_TRAIN_ON_EXIT) {
276 /* It doesn't mean we shouldn't send TPS patters, so let's
277 send the minimal TP1 possible and skip TP2. */
278 val |= EDP_PSR_TP1_TIME_100us;
279 val |= EDP_PSR_TP2_TP3_TIME_0us;
280 val |= EDP_PSR_SKIP_AUX_EXIT;
281 /* Sink should be able to train with the 5 or 6 idle patterns */
282 idle_frames += 4;
283 }
284
285 I915_WRITE(EDP_PSR_CTL(dev), val |
286 (IS_BROADWELL(dev) ? 0 : link_entry_time) |
287 max_sleep_time << EDP_PSR_MAX_SLEEP_TIME_SHIFT |
288 idle_frames << EDP_PSR_IDLE_FRAME_SHIFT |
289 EDP_PSR_ENABLE);
290
291 if (dev_priv->psr.psr2_support)
292 I915_WRITE(EDP_PSR2_CTL, EDP_PSR2_ENABLE |
293 EDP_SU_TRACK_ENABLE | EDP_PSR2_TP2_TIME_100);
294}
295
296static bool intel_psr_match_conditions(struct intel_dp *intel_dp)
297{
298 struct intel_digital_port *dig_port = dp_to_dig_port(intel_dp);
299 struct drm_device *dev = dig_port->base.base.dev;
300 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
301 struct drm_crtc *crtc = dig_port->base.base.crtc;
302 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(crtc);
303
304 lockdep_assert_held(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
305 WARN_ON(!drm_modeset_is_locked(&dev->mode_config.connection_mutex));
306 WARN_ON(!drm_modeset_is_locked(&crtc->mutex));
307
308 dev_priv->psr.source_ok = false;
309
310 if (IS_HASWELL(dev) && dig_port->port != PORT_A) {
311 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("HSW ties PSR to DDI A (eDP)\n");
312 return false;
313 }
314
315 if (!i915.enable_psr) {
316 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("PSR disable by flag\n");
317 return false;
318 }
319
320 if (IS_HASWELL(dev) &&
321 I915_READ(HSW_STEREO_3D_CTL(intel_crtc->config->cpu_transcoder)) &
322 S3D_ENABLE) {
323 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("PSR condition failed: Stereo 3D is Enabled\n");
324 return false;
325 }
326
327 if (IS_HASWELL(dev) &&
328 intel_crtc->config->base.adjusted_mode.flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_INTERLACE) {
329 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("PSR condition failed: Interlaced is Enabled\n");
330 return false;
331 }
332
333 if (!IS_VALLEYVIEW(dev) && ((dev_priv->vbt.psr.full_link) ||
334 (dig_port->port != PORT_A))) {
335 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("PSR condition failed: Link Standby requested/needed but not supported on this platform\n");
336 return false;
337 }
338
339 dev_priv->psr.source_ok = true;
340 return true;
341}
342
343static void intel_psr_activate(struct intel_dp *intel_dp)
344{
345 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port = dp_to_dig_port(intel_dp);
346 struct drm_device *dev = intel_dig_port->base.base.dev;
347 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
348
349 WARN_ON(I915_READ(EDP_PSR_CTL(dev)) & EDP_PSR_ENABLE);
350 WARN_ON(dev_priv->psr.active);
351 lockdep_assert_held(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
352
353 /* Enable/Re-enable PSR on the host */
354 if (HAS_DDI(dev))
355 /* On HSW+ after we enable PSR on source it will activate it
356 * as soon as it match configure idle_frame count. So
357 * we just actually enable it here on activation time.
358 */
359 hsw_psr_enable_source(intel_dp);
360 else
361 vlv_psr_activate(intel_dp);
362
363 dev_priv->psr.active = true;
364}
365
366/**
367 * intel_psr_enable - Enable PSR
368 * @intel_dp: Intel DP
369 *
370 * This function can only be called after the pipe is fully trained and enabled.
371 */
372void intel_psr_enable(struct intel_dp *intel_dp)
373{
374 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port = dp_to_dig_port(intel_dp);
375 struct drm_device *dev = intel_dig_port->base.base.dev;
376 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
377 struct intel_crtc *crtc = to_intel_crtc(intel_dig_port->base.base.crtc);
378
379 if (!HAS_PSR(dev)) {
380 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("PSR not supported on this platform\n");
381 return;
382 }
383
384 if (!is_edp_psr(intel_dp)) {
385 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("PSR not supported by this panel\n");
386 return;
387 }
388
389 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
390 if (dev_priv->psr.enabled) {
391 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("PSR already in use\n");
392 goto unlock;
393 }
394
395 if (!intel_psr_match_conditions(intel_dp))
396 goto unlock;
397
398 dev_priv->psr.busy_frontbuffer_bits = 0;
399
400 if (HAS_DDI(dev)) {
401 hsw_psr_setup_vsc(intel_dp);
402
403 if (dev_priv->psr.psr2_support) {
404 /* PSR2 is restricted to work with panel resolutions upto 3200x2000 */
405 if (crtc->config->pipe_src_w > 3200 ||
406 crtc->config->pipe_src_h > 2000)
407 dev_priv->psr.psr2_support = false;
408 else
409 skl_psr_setup_su_vsc(intel_dp);
410 }
411
412 /* Avoid continuous PSR exit by masking memup and hpd */
413 I915_WRITE(EDP_PSR_DEBUG_CTL(dev), EDP_PSR_DEBUG_MASK_MEMUP |
414 EDP_PSR_DEBUG_MASK_HPD);
415
416 /* Enable PSR on the panel */
417 hsw_psr_enable_sink(intel_dp);
418
419 if (INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 9)
420 intel_psr_activate(intel_dp);
421 } else {
422 vlv_psr_setup_vsc(intel_dp);
423
424 /* Enable PSR on the panel */
425 vlv_psr_enable_sink(intel_dp);
426
427 /* On HSW+ enable_source also means go to PSR entry/active
428 * state as soon as idle_frame achieved and here would be
429 * to soon. However on VLV enable_source just enable PSR
430 * but let it on inactive state. So we might do this prior
431 * to active transition, i.e. here.
432 */
433 vlv_psr_enable_source(intel_dp);
434 }
435
436 dev_priv->psr.enabled = intel_dp;
437unlock:
438 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
439}
440
441static void vlv_psr_disable(struct intel_dp *intel_dp)
442{
443 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port = dp_to_dig_port(intel_dp);
444 struct drm_device *dev = intel_dig_port->base.base.dev;
445 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
446 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc =
447 to_intel_crtc(intel_dig_port->base.base.crtc);
448 uint32_t val;
449
450 if (dev_priv->psr.active) {
451 /* Put VLV PSR back to PSR_state 0 that is PSR Disabled. */
452 if (wait_for((I915_READ(VLV_PSRSTAT(intel_crtc->pipe)) &
453 VLV_EDP_PSR_IN_TRANS) == 0, 1))
454 WARN(1, "PSR transition took longer than expected\n");
455
456 val = I915_READ(VLV_PSRCTL(intel_crtc->pipe));
457 val &= ~VLV_EDP_PSR_ACTIVE_ENTRY;
458 val &= ~VLV_EDP_PSR_ENABLE;
459 val &= ~VLV_EDP_PSR_MODE_MASK;
460 I915_WRITE(VLV_PSRCTL(intel_crtc->pipe), val);
461
462 dev_priv->psr.active = false;
463 } else {
464 WARN_ON(vlv_is_psr_active_on_pipe(dev, intel_crtc->pipe));
465 }
466}
467
468static void hsw_psr_disable(struct intel_dp *intel_dp)
469{
470 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port = dp_to_dig_port(intel_dp);
471 struct drm_device *dev = intel_dig_port->base.base.dev;
472 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
473
474 if (dev_priv->psr.active) {
475 I915_WRITE(EDP_PSR_CTL(dev),
476 I915_READ(EDP_PSR_CTL(dev)) & ~EDP_PSR_ENABLE);
477
478 /* Wait till PSR is idle */
479 if (_wait_for((I915_READ(EDP_PSR_STATUS_CTL(dev)) &
480 EDP_PSR_STATUS_STATE_MASK) == 0, 2000, 10))
481 DRM_ERROR("Timed out waiting for PSR Idle State\n");
482
483 dev_priv->psr.active = false;
484 } else {
485 WARN_ON(I915_READ(EDP_PSR_CTL(dev)) & EDP_PSR_ENABLE);
486 }
487}
488
489/**
490 * intel_psr_disable - Disable PSR
491 * @intel_dp: Intel DP
492 *
493 * This function needs to be called before disabling pipe.
494 */
495void intel_psr_disable(struct intel_dp *intel_dp)
496{
497 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port = dp_to_dig_port(intel_dp);
498 struct drm_device *dev = intel_dig_port->base.base.dev;
499 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
500
501 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
502 if (!dev_priv->psr.enabled) {
503 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
504 return;
505 }
506
507 if (HAS_DDI(dev))
508 hsw_psr_disable(intel_dp);
509 else
510 vlv_psr_disable(intel_dp);
511
512 dev_priv->psr.enabled = NULL;
513 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
514
515 cancel_delayed_work_sync(&dev_priv->psr.work);
516}
517
518static void intel_psr_work(struct work_struct *work)
519{
520 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv =
521 container_of(work, typeof(*dev_priv), psr.work.work);
522 struct intel_dp *intel_dp = dev_priv->psr.enabled;
523 struct drm_crtc *crtc = dp_to_dig_port(intel_dp)->base.base.crtc;
524 enum i915_pipe pipe = to_intel_crtc(crtc)->pipe;
525
526 /* We have to make sure PSR is ready for re-enable
527 * otherwise it keeps disabled until next full enable/disable cycle.
528 * PSR might take some time to get fully disabled
529 * and be ready for re-enable.
530 */
531 if (HAS_DDI(dev_priv->dev)) {
532 if (wait_for((I915_READ(EDP_PSR_STATUS_CTL(dev_priv->dev)) &
533 EDP_PSR_STATUS_STATE_MASK) == 0, 50)) {
534 DRM_ERROR("Timed out waiting for PSR Idle for re-enable\n");
535 return;
536 }
537 } else {
538 if (wait_for((I915_READ(VLV_PSRSTAT(pipe)) &
539 VLV_EDP_PSR_IN_TRANS) == 0, 1)) {
540 DRM_ERROR("Timed out waiting for PSR Idle for re-enable\n");
541 return;
542 }
543 }
544 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
545 intel_dp = dev_priv->psr.enabled;
546
547 if (!intel_dp)
548 goto unlock;
549
550 /*
551 * The delayed work can race with an invalidate hence we need to
552 * recheck. Since psr_flush first clears this and then reschedules we
553 * won't ever miss a flush when bailing out here.
554 */
555 if (dev_priv->psr.busy_frontbuffer_bits)
556 goto unlock;
557
558 intel_psr_activate(intel_dp);
559unlock:
560 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
561}
562
563static void intel_psr_exit(struct drm_device *dev)
564{
565 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
566 struct intel_dp *intel_dp = dev_priv->psr.enabled;
567 struct drm_crtc *crtc = dp_to_dig_port(intel_dp)->base.base.crtc;
568 enum i915_pipe pipe = to_intel_crtc(crtc)->pipe;
569 u32 val;
570
571 if (!dev_priv->psr.active)
572 return;
573
574 if (HAS_DDI(dev)) {
575 val = I915_READ(EDP_PSR_CTL(dev));
576
577 WARN_ON(!(val & EDP_PSR_ENABLE));
578
579 I915_WRITE(EDP_PSR_CTL(dev), val & ~EDP_PSR_ENABLE);
580 } else {
581 val = I915_READ(VLV_PSRCTL(pipe));
582
583 /* Here we do the transition from PSR_state 3 to PSR_state 5
584 * directly once PSR State 4 that is active with single frame
585 * update can be skipped. PSR_state 5 that is PSR exit then
586 * Hardware is responsible to transition back to PSR_state 1
587 * that is PSR inactive. Same state after
588 * vlv_edp_psr_enable_source.
589 */
590 val &= ~VLV_EDP_PSR_ACTIVE_ENTRY;
591 I915_WRITE(VLV_PSRCTL(pipe), val);
592
593 /* Send AUX wake up - Spec says after transitioning to PSR
594 * active we have to send AUX wake up by writing 01h in DPCD
595 * 600h of sink device.
596 * XXX: This might slow down the transition, but without this
597 * HW doesn't complete the transition to PSR_state 1 and we
598 * never get the screen updated.
599 */
600 drm_dp_dpcd_writeb(&intel_dp->aux, DP_SET_POWER,
601 DP_SET_POWER_D0);
602 }
603
604 dev_priv->psr.active = false;
605}
606
607/**
608 * intel_psr_single_frame_update - Single Frame Update
609 * @dev: DRM device
610 * @frontbuffer_bits: frontbuffer plane tracking bits
611 *
612 * Some platforms support a single frame update feature that is used to
613 * send and update only one frame on Remote Frame Buffer.
614 * So far it is only implemented for Valleyview and Cherryview because
615 * hardware requires this to be done before a page flip.
616 */
617void intel_psr_single_frame_update(struct drm_device *dev,
618 unsigned frontbuffer_bits)
619{
620 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
621 struct drm_crtc *crtc;
622 enum i915_pipe pipe;
623 u32 val;
624
625 /*
626 * Single frame update is already supported on BDW+ but it requires
627 * many W/A and it isn't really needed.
628 */
629 if (!IS_VALLEYVIEW(dev))
630 return;
631
632 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
633 if (!dev_priv->psr.enabled) {
634 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
635 return;
636 }
637
638 crtc = dp_to_dig_port(dev_priv->psr.enabled)->base.base.crtc;
639 pipe = to_intel_crtc(crtc)->pipe;
640
641 if (frontbuffer_bits & INTEL_FRONTBUFFER_ALL_MASK(pipe)) {
642 val = I915_READ(VLV_PSRCTL(pipe));
643
644 /*
645 * We need to set this bit before writing registers for a flip.
646 * This bit will be self-clear when it gets to the PSR active state.
647 */
648 I915_WRITE(VLV_PSRCTL(pipe), val | VLV_EDP_PSR_SINGLE_FRAME_UPDATE);
649 }
650 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
651}
652
653/**
654 * intel_psr_invalidate - Invalidade PSR
655 * @dev: DRM device
656 * @frontbuffer_bits: frontbuffer plane tracking bits
657 *
658 * Since the hardware frontbuffer tracking has gaps we need to integrate
659 * with the software frontbuffer tracking. This function gets called every
660 * time frontbuffer rendering starts and a buffer gets dirtied. PSR must be
661 * disabled if the frontbuffer mask contains a buffer relevant to PSR.
662 *
663 * Dirty frontbuffers relevant to PSR are tracked in busy_frontbuffer_bits."
664 */
665void intel_psr_invalidate(struct drm_device *dev,
666 unsigned frontbuffer_bits)
667{
668 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
669 struct drm_crtc *crtc;
670 enum i915_pipe pipe;
671
672 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
673 if (!dev_priv->psr.enabled) {
674 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
675 return;
676 }
677
678 crtc = dp_to_dig_port(dev_priv->psr.enabled)->base.base.crtc;
679 pipe = to_intel_crtc(crtc)->pipe;
680
681 frontbuffer_bits &= INTEL_FRONTBUFFER_ALL_MASK(pipe);
682 dev_priv->psr.busy_frontbuffer_bits |= frontbuffer_bits;
683
684 if (frontbuffer_bits)
685 intel_psr_exit(dev);
686
687 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
688}
689
690/**
691 * intel_psr_flush - Flush PSR
692 * @dev: DRM device
693 * @frontbuffer_bits: frontbuffer plane tracking bits
694 * @origin: which operation caused the flush
695 *
696 * Since the hardware frontbuffer tracking has gaps we need to integrate
697 * with the software frontbuffer tracking. This function gets called every
698 * time frontbuffer rendering has completed and flushed out to memory. PSR
699 * can be enabled again if no other frontbuffer relevant to PSR is dirty.
700 *
701 * Dirty frontbuffers relevant to PSR are tracked in busy_frontbuffer_bits.
702 */
703void intel_psr_flush(struct drm_device *dev,
704 unsigned frontbuffer_bits, enum fb_op_origin origin)
705{
706 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
707 struct drm_crtc *crtc;
708 enum i915_pipe pipe;
709 int delay_ms = HAS_DDI(dev) ? 100 : 500;
710
711 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
712 if (!dev_priv->psr.enabled) {
713 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
714 return;
715 }
716
717 crtc = dp_to_dig_port(dev_priv->psr.enabled)->base.base.crtc;
718 pipe = to_intel_crtc(crtc)->pipe;
719
720 frontbuffer_bits &= INTEL_FRONTBUFFER_ALL_MASK(pipe);
721 dev_priv->psr.busy_frontbuffer_bits &= ~frontbuffer_bits;
722
723 if (HAS_DDI(dev)) {
724 /*
725 * By definition every flush should mean invalidate + flush,
726 * however on core platforms let's minimize the
727 * disable/re-enable so we can avoid the invalidate when flip
728 * originated the flush.
729 */
730 if (frontbuffer_bits && origin != ORIGIN_FLIP)
731 intel_psr_exit(dev);
732 } else {
733 /*
734 * On Valleyview and Cherryview we don't use hardware tracking
735 * so any plane updates or cursor moves don't result in a PSR
736 * invalidating. Which means we need to manually fake this in
737 * software for all flushes.
738 */
739 if (frontbuffer_bits)
740 intel_psr_exit(dev);
741 }
742
743 if (!dev_priv->psr.active && !dev_priv->psr.busy_frontbuffer_bits)
744 schedule_delayed_work(&dev_priv->psr.work,
745 msecs_to_jiffies(delay_ms));
746 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
747}
748
749/**
750 * intel_psr_init - Init basic PSR work and mutex.
751 * @dev: DRM device
752 *
753 * This function is called only once at driver load to initialize basic
754 * PSR stuff.
755 */
756void intel_psr_init(struct drm_device *dev)
757{
758 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
759
760 INIT_DELAYED_WORK(&dev_priv->psr.work, intel_psr_work);
761#ifdef __NetBSD__
762 linux_mutex_init(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
763#else
764 mutex_init(&dev_priv->psr.lock);
765#endif
766}
